snippet: The timing of J. R. Smith’s knee surgery raised questions about whether the Knicks should have invested four years and $24.5 million in him. It turns out they didn’t.
abstract: Revelation that J R Smith had knee surgery just four days after signing four-year contract makes New York Knicks’ investment look ill-advised; surgery was not a surprise to team officials, however; and  investment not as extensive as first believed;  Smith’s deal covers a maximum of three years, with a total value of $17.95 million, not the four years and $24.5 million that was widely reported,
lead_paragraph: The timing of J. R. Smith’s knee surgery raised questions about whether the Knicks should have invested four years and $24.5 million in him. It turns out they didn’t.

headline.main: Smith’s Knee Surgery Does Not Surprise the Knicks, Who Are Investing Less
headline.print_headline: Smith’s Knee Surgery Does Not Surprise the Knicks, Who Are Investing Less
